topic.title: How to Use Dynamic Images in Headers and Footers

body.p: There are cases in which is needed to change the images from the publication header depending on the current section.

For example, you want to place an image that describes the current section. Assuming that the titles of the sections define some metadata attribute pointing to some image file. The image references should be absolute URIs or relative to the input document.
The CSS should define a string-set that extracts the attribute value and builds an image for it using the attr(.., url) or url function.
body.note: The attr(name, url) function resolves the reference relative to the input XML document URI. The url(attr(name)) resolves the reference relative to the CSS file URI.
